channel.title: Duckdb on ETLX | ETL / ELT Framework for Data Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Duckdb on ETLX | ETL / ELT Framework for Data Engineering

item.title: Overview
item.description:
Welcome to the ETLX documentation.

This guide explains what ETLX is, why it exists, and how to think about it before diving into pipelines, configuration, and execution details.

If you are looking for a fast way to get started, jump directly to the Quickstart.

What is ETLX? link

ETLX is an open-source, developer-first ETL framework designed to make data pipelines:

  • Simpler
  • More transparent
  • Easier to reason about
  • Fully observable and reproducible

Instead of relying on heavyweight orchestration platforms or opaque runtime behavior, ETLX embraces a declarative, metadata-first approach.

item.title: DuckDB at the Core
item.description:
DuckDB at the Core link

ETLX is built around DuckDB as its execution engine. At its core, ETLX embraces a SQL-first philosophy, enabling powerful in-process analytics and transformations without requiring external compute engines or distributed systems.

DuckDB acts as the analytical backbone of the pipeline, executing transformations, validations, exports, and even orchestration-related logic using standard SQL.

ðŸ§  Why DuckDB? link

DuckDB is a modern analytical database designed for OLAP workloads, embedded directly into applications. This makes it a perfect fit for ETLX.
